title: UnitedHealth Group Names Andrew Witty as Chief Executive
sub_head: The provider of health care coverage, software, and data consulting firm services says Witty will succeed David S. Wichmann, who is retiring
body:
UnitedHealth Group said it named Andrew Witty as chief executive, succeeding David S. Wichmann, who is retiring.
The provider of health care coverage, software, and data consulting firm services said Dirk McMahon will become president, chief operating officer and will join Mr. Witty and Chief Financial Officer John Rex in the chief executive office.
UnitedHealth Group offers products and services through two platforms: UnitedHealthcare and Optum.
Mr. Witty was named CEO of Optum in March 2018 and added the role of president of UnitedHealth Group in November 2019. He previously served as a UnitedHealth Group company director.
From April 2020 to December 2020, Mr. Witty took an unpaid leave of absence from his company positions to serve as a Global Envoy for the World Health Organizationâ€™s Covid-19 efforts.
